alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:25PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Davidson, northern Williamson and southeastern Cheatham Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 425 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bellevue, or 12 miles northwest of Franklin, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Brentwood, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Belle Meade, Kingston Springs, Pegram, Fairview, Bellevue, Bells Bend, Leipers Fork and Natchez Trace At Highway 96. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 182 and 204. Interstate 65 between mile markers 66 and 73. Interstate 840 between mile markers 7 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
